column4: I'm trying to help my brother with his laptop. He's running 9.04 on his laptop, and when he starts his laptop it just shows lines going across and wont boot to the desktop. Any ideas?
sounds like the xwindows resolution is fouled up.
is there a way to fix it? I can boot into live CD
When the laptop starts can you use CTRL-ALT-F1 to get to a console?
I'm going to try right now
I'm at the grub menu. Is that where I'm supposed to be?
No, where you get those lines you were talking about.
I just tried. After I get to the part with the lines and what looks like Chinese writing across the top, I tried CTRL - ALT - F1 and nothing happened
Is the laptop on a network?  Can you ping it?
I do have it plugged into my router, but how would I find it's IP address?
nevermind that now.  What happens when you type ALT-SYSRQ-K?
I don't know how far into the linux startup your machine is getting.
do you think I need to re-install
after the grub menu, it flashes the lines for about 10 seconds or so
did you see eremite's comment to me?
I'm going to leave you in eremite's hands.  I have to go to work... at least until I pick up my lottery winnings :-)
